thread.title: Erin Andrews seeks $75 million from Nashville hotel over peeping tom video
thread.title_full: Erin Andrews seeks $75 million from Nashville hotel over peeping tom video | AL.com

author: Erin Edgemon | eedgemon@al.com
title: Erin Andrews seeks $75 million from Nashville hotel over peeping tom video
text:
Former ESPN personality Erin Andrews is seeking $75 million from a Nashville hotel she says allowed her stalker to book a room next to hers and film her through a peephole in 2008.
Revised court documents filed in Nashville shows Andrews is now seeking the large sum from Marriott International, Nashville Marriott at Vanderbilt University, Windsor Capital Group and her convicted stalker David Barrett, the Tennessean reported.
In previous versions of the lawsuit, originally filed in 2010, Andrews sought $10 million.
The revisions were filed earlier this week after attorneys for the hotel asked for clarification on the amount of damages sought in the case.
Barrett pleaded guilty to stalking Andrews in 2009. He was sentenced to serve 30 months in prison in March 2010.
Andrews was in Nashville in 2008 covering a Vanderbilt University football game when she says Marriott allowed Barrett to book a room next to hers, create peepholes and film her changing clothes. Videos of Andrews changing were later posted to the Internet and went viral.
Andrews accuses Marriott of negligence, infliction of emotional distress and invasion of privacy.
Trial is set for February.
